Sugarcss

v1.0.0-alpha.55

s-color

Type:Function
Status:stable
Since:0.0.1
Platform:css
@lotsof.sugarcss.css.function

Apply a color from the colors registered ones. Allow to apply modifiers or shades to the color like darken, lighten, saturate, desaturate, spin, etc… Here’s the list of available modifiers:

  • lightness: 0-100
  • lighten: 0-100
  • darken: 0-100
  • saturation: 0-100
  • saturate: 0-100
  • desaturate: 0-100
  • hue: 0-360
  • spin: 0-360
  • alpha: 0-1

The shades are registered like so: —s-shade-placeholder: —darken 10;

Params

  1. color*String

    The color name you want to apply like “main”, “accent”, etc…

  2. shadeOrModifiers*String

    The shade name you want to apply like “text”, “placeholder”, etc… or a string of modifiers like —lighten 10 —saturate 20

  3. modifiers*String

    A string of modifiers like —lighten 10 —saturate 20, etc…

Return

  1. The generated cssCss

Example

:root {
   --s-shade-test: --lighten 10;
}

.my-element {
  color: s-color(accent);
  color: s-color(accent, test);
  color: s-color(accent, --darken 20 --spin 30);
}
